qas.question: What Macedonian ruler helped to advance Greek beliefs and ways of life ?
How was this achievement of advancing culture undertaken ?

answers.text: provided an important outlet for Greek culture, via the creation of colonies and trade routes along the way

qas.question: What types of cities did the expansion of the great ruler inspire ?
Are any relatives of the first people of  the Grecian world still around ?

answers.text: there are still communities in Pakistan and Afghanistan, like the Kalash, who claim to be descended from Greek settlers.

qas.question: Name a city that the Greeks nested in ?

answers.text: cities like Alexandria, Antioch and Seleucia.

qas.question: What Macedonian ruler didn't help to advance Greek beliefs and ways of life?

plausible_answers.text: provided an important outlet for Greek culture, via the creation of colonies and trade routes along the way

qas.question: How wasn't this achievement of advancing culture undertaken?
What types of cities didn't the expansion of the great ruler inspire?

plausible_answers.text: there are still communities in Pakistan and Afghanistan, like the Kalash, who claim to be descended from Greek settlers

qas.question: Are any relatives of the first people of the Grecian world no longer around?

context: In any case, <a0_0><b5_0>Alexander<a0_0/>'s<b5_0/> toppling of the Achaemenid Empire, after his victories at the battles of the Granicus, Issus and Gaugamela, and his advance as far as modern-day Pakistan and Tajikistan, <a1_0><b6_0>provided an important outlet for Greek culture, via the creation of colonies and trade routes along the way<b6_0/><a1_0/>. While the Alexandrian empire did not survive its creator's death intact, the cultural implications of the spread of <b7_0>Hellenism<b7_0/> across much of the Middle East and Asia were to prove long lived as Greek became the lingua franca, a position it retained even in Roman times. Many Greeks settled in <a2_0>Hellenistic <a4_0>cities<a2_0/> like Alexandria, Antioch and Seleucia.<a4_0/> Two thousand years later, <a3_0><b8_0>there are still communities in Pakistan and Afghanistan, like the Kalash, who claim to be descended from Greek settlers<b8_0/>.
